tit.e: The Rokumei-kan Pavilion (the Deer Cry Pavilion)
The Rokumei-kan Pavilion (the Deer Cry Pavilion, a palace of social interaction built by the Meiji Government)
The Rokumei-kan Pavilion (the Deer Cry Pavilion, a palace of social interaction built by the Meiji Government)

sen.j: 鹿鳴館（ろくめいかん）とは外国からの賓客や外交官を接待するために明治政府によって建てられた社交場である。
sen.e: The "Rokumei-kan Pavilion" is a place of social interaction built by the Meiji Government in order to receive diplomats and international guests of honor.
Rokumei-kan Pavilion is a place of social interaction built by the Meiji Government in order to receive diplomats and international guests of honor.
Rokumei-kan Pavilion is a place of social interaction built by the Meiji Government in order to receive diplomats and international guests of honor.

sen.j: 当時の急激な西欧化を象徴する存在でもある。
sen.e: It is also an existence that represents the rapid westernization of the time.
It is also an existence that represents the rapid westernization of the time.
It is also an existence that represents the rapid westernization of the time.

sen.j: また、鹿鳴館を中心にした外交政策を「鹿鳴館外交」とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: In addition, a foreign policy centering on the Rokumei-kan Pavilion is called 'Rokumeikan Gaiko' (the Rokumei-kan Pavilion Diplomacy).
In addition, a foreign policy centering on the Rokumei-kan Pavilion is called 'Rokumeikan Gaiko' (the Rokumei-kan Pavilion Diplomacy).
In addition, a foreign policy centering on the Rokumei-kan Pavilion is called 'Rokumeikan Gaiko' (the Rokumei-kan Pavilion Diplomacy).

sen.j: 計画を推進したのは外務卿（内閣制度以降は外務大臣 (日本)）井上馨である。
sen.e: It is the Gaimu-kyo (called the Minister of Foreign Affairs after the introduction of the cabinet system (in Japan)), Kaoru INOUE, who promoted the plan.
It is the Gaimu-kyo (called the Minister of Foreign Affairs after the introduction of the cabinet system [in Japan]), Kaoru INOUE, who promoted the plan.
It is the Gaimu-kyo (called the Minister of Foreign Affairs after the introduction of the cabinet system [in Japan]), Kaoru INOUE, who promoted the plan.

sen.j: 当時の日本外交の課題は不平等条約改正交渉、特に外国人に対する治外法権の撤廃であった。
sen.e: The topic of the Japanese foreign policy of the time concerned negotiations to revise unequal treaties, especially to remove the extraterritorial rights of foreigners.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The topic of the Japanese foreign policy of the time concerned negotiations to revise unequal treaties, especially to remove the extraterritorial rights of foreigners.
The topic of the Japanese foreign policy of the time concerned negotiations to revise unequal treaties, especially to remove the extraterritorial rights of foreigners.

sen.j: だが、日本に住む外国人の多くは数年前まで行われていた磔刑や打ち首を実際に目撃していた。
sen.e: However, many of those living in Japan had actually witnessed crucifixion and decapitation, which had been practiced until a few years ago.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, many of those living in Japan had actually witnessed crucifixion and decapitation, which had been practiced until a few years ago.
However, many of those living in Japan had actually witnessed crucifixion and decapitation, which had been practiced until a few years ago.

sen.j: 外国政府は自国民が残酷な刑罰に処せられることを危惧していた。
sen.e: Foreign governments were apprehensive of a possible punishment of their citizens.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Foreign governments were apprehensive of a possible punishment of their citizens.
Foreign governments were apprehensive of a possible punishment of their citizens.

sen.j: そして、治外法権撤廃に強硬に反対していた。
sen.e: And they were vehemently opposed to the abolition of the extraterritorial rights.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And they were vehemently opposed to the abolition of the extraterritorial rights.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: And they were vehemently opposed to the abolition of the extraterritorial rights.

sen.j: そのため、井上は日本が文明国であることを外国人に示す必要があると考えた。
sen.e: Thus, Inoue considered it necessary to show it to foreigners that Japan was a civilized country.
Thus, Inoue considered it necessary to show it to foreigners that Japan was a civilized country.
Thus, Inoue considered it necessary to show it to foreigners that Japan was a civilized country.

sen.j: それまでは外国賓客の迎賓館として準備された建物はなかった。
sen.e: Until then, there was no building that was built as a guest house for VIPS from abroad.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Until then, there was no building that was built as a guest house for VIPS from abroad.
Until then, there was no building that was built as a guest house for VIPS from abroad.

sen.j: そして、1870年（明治3年）、急遽改修した浜離宮の延遼館かあるいは三田の蜂須賀邸などを借用していた。
sen.e: In 1870, the government was borrowing the Enryo-kan Mansion of the Hama-rikyu Imperial Villa that was repaired in haste, the Hachisuka-tei Residence in Mita, and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In 1870, the government was borrowing the Enryo-kan Mansion of the Hama-rikyu Imperial Villa that was repaired in haste, the Hachisuka-tei Residence in Mita, and so on.
In 1870, the government was borrowing the Enryo-kan Mansion of the Hama-rikyu Imperial Villa that was repaired in haste, the Hachisuka-tei Residence in Mita, and so on.

sen.j: 鹿鳴館の建設地は内山下町の旧薩摩藩装束屋敷跡（現在の千代田区内幸町、現帝国ホテル隣の大和生命ビルの地）に決まった。
sen.e: It was decided to build the Rokumei-kan Pavilion in the once Shozoku-yashiki Premises of the former Satsuma Domain in Uchiyamashita Town (where there is Yamato Life Insurance Building next to the present Imperial Hotel in current Uchisaiwai Town, Chiyoda Ward).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It was decided to build the Rokumei-kan Pavilion in the once Shozoku-yashiki Premises of the former Satsuma clan in Uchiyamashita Town (where there is Yamato Life Insurance Building next to the present Imperial Hotel in current Uchisaiwai Town, Chiyoda Ward).

It was decided to build the Rokumei-kan Pavilion in the once Shozoku-yashiki Premises of the former Satsuma clan in Uchiyamashita Town (where there is Yamato Life Insurance Building next to the present Imperial Hotel in current Uchisaiwai Town, Chiyoda Ward).

sen.j: そして、1880年（明治13年）に着手。
sen.e: And the construction began in 1880.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And the construction began in 1880.
And the construction began in 1880.

sen.j: 途中規模変更（拡大）があった。
sen.e: The scale was modified (or enlarged) halfway.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The scale was modified (or enlarged) halfway.
The scale was modified (or enlarged) halfway.

sen.j: 3年がかりで1883年（明治16年）7月、落成。
sen.e: The construction was finished three years later in July 1883.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The construction was finished three years later in July 1883.
The construction was finished three years later in July 1883.

sen.j: 設計はお雇い外国人のジョサイア・コンドルである。
sen.e: An employed foreigner, Josiah Conder, designed the Rokumei-kan Pavilion.
An employed foreigner, Josiah Conder, designed the Rokumei-kan Pavilion.
An employed foreigner, Josiah Conder, designed the Rokumei-kan Pavilion.

sen.j: 施工は土木用達組（大倉喜八郎と堀川利尚との共同出資で設立した組織）が担当した。
sen.e: And Doboku Yotatsugumi (a civil engineering company established by the joint investment of Kihachiro OKURA and Toshinao HORIKAWA) took charge of the construction.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And Doboku Yotatsugumi (a civil engineering company established by the joint investment of Kihachiro OKURA and Toshinao HORIKAWA) took charge of the construction.
And Doboku Yotatsugumi (a civil engineering company established by the joint investment of Kihachiro OKURA and Toshinao HORIKAWA) took charge of the construction.

sen.j: （大倉喜八郎が創立した大倉組商会の建設部門は大成建設の源流である。）
sen.e: (Taisei Corporation has its root in the construction department of Okuragumi Shokai founded by Kihachiro OKURA.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: (Taisei Corporation has its root in the construction department of Okuragumi Shokai founded by Kihachiro OKURA.)
(Taisei Corporation has its root in the construction department of Okuragumi Shokai founded by Kihachiro OKURA.)

sen.j: 煉瓦造。
sen.e: It was built of brick.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It was built of brick.
It was built of brick.

sen.j: 2階建てであった。
sen.e: And it had two stories.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And it had two-storey.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: And it had two-storey.

sen.j: 1階に大食堂、談話室、書籍室など、2階が舞踏室であった。
sen.e: It had a dining hall, a common room, a library, etc. on the first floor and a dancing room on the second floor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It had a dining hall, a common room, a library, and so on, on the first floor and a dancing room on the second floor.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: It had a dining hall, a common room, a library, and so on, on the first floor and a dancing room on the second floor.

sen.j: そして、3室開け放つと100坪ほどの広間になった。
sen.e: And it had a space as big as 100 tsubo (a unit of floor space that is about 330 square meters) when the doors of the three rooms were flung open.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And it had a space as big as 100 tsubo (a unit of floor space that is about 330 square meters) when the doors of the three rooms were opened.
And it had a space as big as 100 tsubo (a unit of floor space that is about 330 square meters) when the doors of the three rooms were opened.

sen.j: バー (酒場)やビリヤードも設備されていた。
sen.e: It was also equipped with a bar and billiards.
It was also equipped with a bar and billiards.
It was also equipped with a bar and billiards.

sen.j: 鹿鳴館時代
sen.e: The Period of the Rokumei-kan Pavilion
The Period of the Rokumei-kan Pavilion
The Period of the Rokumei-kan Pavilion

sen.j: 1883年（明治16年）11月28日、1200名を招待して落成の祝宴が行われた。
sen.e: A banquet was held in celebration of the completion of the construction work with 1200 invitees on November 28, 1883.
A banquet was held in celebration of the completion of the construction work with 1200 invitees on November 28, 1883.
A banquet was held in celebration of the completion of the construction work with 1200 invitees on November 28, 1883.

sen.j: 鹿鳴の名は詩経「鹿鳴の詩」から引用して中井弘（桜洲）が名付けた。
sen.e: Hiroshi NAKAI (Oshu) named the building Rokumei (a Deer Cry) citing a verse, 'Rokumei no Uta' (the Deer Cry Verse), in Shi Jing (the Book of Songs).
Hiroshi NAKAI (Oshu) named the building Rokumei (a Deer Cry) citing a verse, 'Rokumei no Uta' (the Deer Cry Verse), in Shi Jing (the Book of Songs).
Hiroshi NAKAI (Oshu) named the building Rokumei (a Deer Cry) citing a verse, 'Rokumei no Uta' (the Deer Cry Verse), in Shi Jing (the Book of Songs).

sen.j: 祝宴当日は井上馨の誕生日であった。
sen.e: The day of the feast was also the birthday of Kaoru INOUE.
The day of the feast was the birthday of Kaoru INOUE.
The day of the feast was the birthday of Kaoru INOUE.

sen.j: 鹿鳴館では外国からの賓客接待ばかりでなく、天長節（11月3日、明治天皇誕生日）の祝賀会行事をはじめ数々の国内行事も行われるようになった。
sen.e: The Rokumei-kan Pavilion began to be used, not only to receive international guests of honor, but also to convene many domestic events including a celebration of Tencho Setsu (a day to pray for the emperor's long life on November 3, which is also the birthday of the Emperor Meiji).

The Rokumei-kan Pavilion began to be used, not only to receive international guests of honor, but also to convene many domestic events including a celebration of Tencho Setsu (a day to pray for the emperor's long life on November 3, which was also the birthday of the Emperor Meiji).

The Rokumei-kan Pavilion began to be used, not only to receive international guests of honor, but also to convene many domestic events including a celebration of Tencho Setsu (a day to pray for the emperor's long life on November 3, which was also the birthday of the Emperor Meiji).

sen.j: これらの夜会、舞踏会、婦人慈善会が世間の注目を集めた。
sen.e: These soirées, balls, and women's charity galas attracted public attention.
These evening parties, balls, and women's charity galas attracted public attention.
These evening parties, balls, and women's charity galas attracted public attention.

sen.j: 一方、欧化政策を批判する国粋主義者は「嬌奢を競い淫逸にいたる退廃的行事」として非難の声を挙げていた。
sen.e: On the other hand, nationalists attacking the Europeanization policy were crying fowl, criticizing these events as being 'decadent functions leading to competition for lust and luxury and to indulgence in pleasure.'
On the other hand, nationalists attacking the Europeanization policy criticized these events as being 'decadent functions leading to competition for lust and luxury and to indulgence in pleasure.'
On the other hand, nationalists attacking the Europeanization policy criticized these events as being 'decadent functions leading to competition for lust and luxury and to indulgence in pleasure.'

sen.j: また当時舞踏会のマナーやルールをあまり理解できてなかった日本人。
sen.e: At the time, Japanese people did not understand the rules and manners of the balls very well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: At the time, Japanese people did not understand the rules and manners of the balls very well.
At the time, Japanese people did not understand the rules and manners of the balls very well.

sen.j: フィンガーボールの水を飲料水と勘違いして飲んだり服装がしわくちゃでとてもみっともない格好になっていたりコルセットをギリギリまできつくしめるなど明らかに常識外れの行動をとっていた。
sen.e: And they clearly acted out of line, drinking the water of a finger bowl thinking it was drinking water, looking shabby in wrinkled clothes, tightening corsets to an extreme, and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And they clearly acted out of line, drinking the water of a finger bowl thinking it was drinking water, looking shabby in wrinkled clothes, tightening corsets to an extreme, and so on.
And they clearly acted out of line, drinking the water of a finger bowl thinking it was drinking water, looking shabby in wrinkled clothes, tightening corsets to an extreme, and so on.

sen.j: そのため、西欧諸国の外交官もうわべでは連夜の舞踏会を楽しみながら、書面や日記などには「滑稽」などと記して嘲笑していた。
sen.e: Thus, the diplomats of Western countries were scoffing at the balls that were being held night after night describing them as 'ludicrous' and so on in their letters, diaries, and so forth, while they outwardly enjoyed the events.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Thus, the diplomats of Western countries were scoffing at the balls that were being held night after night describing them as 'ludicrous' and so on in their letters, diaries, and so forth, while they outwardly enjoyed the events.

Thus, the diplomats of Western countries were scoffing at the balls that were being held night after night describing them as 'ludicrous' and so on in their letters, diaries, and so forth, while they outwardly enjoyed the events.

sen.j: 井上の鹿鳴館外交への風当たりは次第に厳しいものとなった。
sen.e: Inoue's Rokumeikan Gaiko increasingly came under intense pressure from the public.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Inoue's Rokumeikan Gaiko increasingly came under intense pressure from the public.
Inoue's Rokumeikan Gaiko increasingly came under intense pressure from the public.

sen.j: そして、さらに条約改正案（外国人判事の任用など）が世間に知られると、大反対が起こった
sen.e: And it faced a fierce opposition when the proposals for revising treaties (for example, the appointment of foreign judges) became public.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And it faced a fierce opposition when the proposals for revising treaties (for example, the appointment of foreign judges) became public.
And it faced a fierce opposition when the proposals for revising treaties (for example, the appointment of foreign judges) became public.

sen.j: 面目を失した井上は1887年（明治20年）4月9月に外務大臣を辞任した。
sen.e: Inoue lost face and resigned his position as the Minister of Foreign Affairs on April 9, 1887.
Inoue lost face and resigned his position as the Minister of Foreign Affairs on September, 1887.
sen.cmt: 原文の「4月9月」は「9月」を指すと思われるため、「9月」として訳出しています。
sen.e: Inoue lost face and resigned his position as the Minister of Foreign Affairs on September, 1887.

sen.j: なお、井上の辞任後も1888年～1890年、1893年（明治21～23、26年）の天長節夜会は鹿鳴館で開催された。
sen.e: However, a soirées was still held in the Rokumei-kan Pavilion on Tencho Setsu, even after his resignation, during the period between 1888 and 1890 and in 1893.
However, an evening party was still held in the Rokumei-kan Pavilion on Tencho Settsu, even after his resignation, during the period between 1888 and 1890 and in 1893.
However, an evening party was still held in the Rokumei-kan Pavilion on Tencho Settsu, even after his resignation, during the period between 1888 and 1890 and in 1893.

sen.j: 首相官邸の仮装舞踏会
sen.e: Masquerades in the Prime Minister's Official Residence
Masquerades in the Prime Minister's Official Residence
Masquerades in the Prime Minister's Official Residence

sen.j: 井上外交の中でも有名な1887年（明治20年）4月20日の仮装舞踏会（ファンシー・ボール）は鹿鳴館ではなく、首相官邸で行われたものである。
sen.e: One of the most famous events of Inoue's Diplomacy, a masquerade (a fancy ball) of April 20, 1887, was not held in the Rokumei-kan Pavilion but in his official residence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: One of the most famous events of Inoue's Diplomacy, a masquerade (a fancy ball) of April 20, 1887, was not held in the Rokumei-kan Pavilion but in his official residence.
One of the most famous events of Inoue's Diplomacy, a masquerade (a fancy ball) of April 20, 1887, was not held in the Rokumei-kan Pavilion but in his official residence.

sen.j: （一般には伊藤博文首相夫妻主催とされている。）
sen.e: (It is generally believed that it was held under the auspices of Prime Minister Hrobumi ITO and his wife.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: (It is generally believed that it was held under the auspices of Prime Minister Hirobumi ITO and his wife.)
(It is generally believed that it was held under the auspices of Prime Minister Hirobumi ITO and his wife.)

sen.j: （だが、実際にはイギリス公使夫妻主催であった。）
sen.e: (However, it was actually sponsored by the British envoy and his wife.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。公使には一般的な"a minister"のほか、全権公使という意味の'an envoy"、特命全権公使という意味の"an envoy extraordinary and minister plenipotentiary"、そして、代理公使という意味の"a chargé d'affaires"があります。
sen.e: (However, it was actually sponsored by the British envoy and his wife.)
(However, it was actually sponsored by the British envoy and his wife.)

sen.j: （そして、伊藤首相の好意で会場として貸し出されたものとされている。）
sen.e: (And it is said that Prime Minister Ito rented his official residence out of goodwill.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: (And it is said that Prime Minister Ito rented his official residence out of goodwill.)
(And it is said that Prime Minister Ito rented his official residence out of goodwill.)

sen.j: 国粋主義者は、この仮装舞踏会が開催されるや「亡国のきざし」と口を極めて罵った。
sen.e: No sooner was this masquerade held than the nationalists reviled it as 'a sign of the ruin of the country.'
No sooner was this masquerade held than the nationalists reviled it as 'a sign of the ruin of the country.'
No sooner was this masquerade held than the nationalists reviled it as 'a sign of the ruin of the country.'

sen.j: 勝海舟は憂国の感を深めた。
sen.e: Kaishu KATSU deepened his feelings of patriotism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Kaishu KATSU deepened his feelings of patriotism.
Kaishu KATSU deepened his feelings of patriotism.

sen.j: そして、21か条の時弊を挙げて政府に建白した。
sen.e: And he submitted a petition citing twenty-one abuses of the times to the Government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And he submitted a petition citing 21 abuses of the times to the Government.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: And he submitted a petition citing 21 abuses of the times to the Government.

sen.j: その後
sen.e: Thereafter
Thereafter
Thereafter

sen.j: 1890年（明治23年）、宮内省に払い下げられた。
sen.e: In 1890 the Rokumei-kan Pavilion was sold to the Imperial Household Ministry.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In 1890 the Rokumei-kan Pavilion was sold to the Imperial Household Ministry.
In 1890 the Rokumei-kan Pavilion was sold to the Imperial Household Ministry.

sen.j: 華族会館が一部を使用。
sen.e: A part of it was used by the Kazoku-kaikan Assembly Hall (commonly known as the Peer's Club).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: A part of it was used by the Kazoku-kaikan Assembly Hall (commonly known as the Peer's Club).
A part of it was used by the Kazoku-kaikan Assembly Hall (commonly known as the Peer's Club).

sen.j: 1894年（明治27年）6月20日の明治東京地震で被災した。
sen.e: It was struck by the Meiji Tokyo Earthquake on June 20, 1894.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It was struck by the Meiji Tokyo Earthquake on June 20, 1894.
It was struck by the Meiji Tokyo Earthquake on June 20, 1894.

sen.j: 修復後、土地・建物が霞会館に払い下げられた。
sen.e: After restoration, it was sold to the Kasumi-kaikan Assembly Hall.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: After restoration, the land and building were sold to the Kasumi-kaikan Assembly Hall.
After restoration, the land and building were sold to the Kasumi-kaikan Assembly Hall.

sen.j: 旧鹿鳴館の建物は1927年（昭和2年）、徴兵生命保険（現・大和生命保険）に売却された後も保存されていた。
sen.e: The building that used to be the Rokumei-kan Pavilion was preserved, even after it was sold to Chohei Seimei Hoken (Conscription Life Insurance, or the present Yamato Life Insurance Co. Ltd.).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The building that used to be the Rokumei-kan Pavilion was preserved, even after it was sold to Chohei Seimei Hoken (Conscription Life Insurance, or the present Yamato Life Insurance Co. Ltd.) in 1927.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「1927年」を補足しました。
sen.e: The building that used to be the Rokumei-kan Pavilion was preserved, even after it was sold to Chohei Seimei Hoken (Conscription Life Insurance, or the present Yamato Life Insurance Co. Ltd.) in 1927.

sen.j: だが、1940年（昭和15年）に取壊された。
sen.e: However, it was destroyed in 1940.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, it was destroyed in 1940.
However, it was destroyed in 1940.

sen.j: なお、鹿鳴館の正門として使用された旧薩摩藩装束屋敷跡の通称「黒門」は旧国宝に指定されていた。
sen.e: Incidentally, the so-called 'Kuro-mon Gate' that was in the once Shozoku-yashiki Premises of the former Satsuma Domain and that was used as the main gate of the Rokumei-kan Pavilion was designated as a former national treasure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Incidentally, the so-called 'Kuro-mon Gate' that was in the once Shozoku-yashiki Premises of the former Satsuma clan and that was used as the main gate of the Rokumei-kan Pavilion was designated as a former national treasure.

Incidentally, the so-called 'Kuro-mon Gate' that was in the once Shozoku-yashiki Premises of the former Satsuma clan and that was used as the main gate of the Rokumei-kan Pavilion was designated as a former national treasure.

sen.j: だが、1945年（昭和20年）、空襲により焼失した。
sen.e: However, it was destroyed by an air strike in 1945.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, it was destroyed by an air strike in 1945.
However, it was destroyed by an air strike in 1945.

sen.j: 1940年3月9日の東京日日新聞は以下のように報じている。
sen.e: The Tokyo Nichi Nichi Shinbun (Tokyo Daily News) published a report below on March 9, 1940.
The Tokyo Nichi Nichi Shinbun (Tokyo Daily News) published a report on March 9, 1940 as follows.
The Tokyo Nichi Nichi Shinbun (Tokyo Daily News) published a report on March 9, 1940 as follows.

sen.j: 「日本徴兵保険会社では最近のビル飢饉時代に建物に比較して広大な敷地を遊ばしておくのは土一升、金一升の場所から惜しいところでもあり、不経済であるとの理由で建物の取毀しを決定したともいはれる。」
sen.e: It is said that Japan Conscription Insurance Company decided to destroy the building because it was a waste and bad economy to let a lot, which was large relative to the building, sit idle in the period, in which there is a dearth of buildings and a sho (a unit of volume that is equivalent to approximately 1.8 liters) of soil is worth a sho of gold.'

It is said that Japan Conscription Insurance Company decided to destroy the building because it was a waste and bad economy to let a lot, which was large relative to the building, sit idle in the period, in which there is a dearth of buildings and a sho (a unit of volume that is equivalent to approximately 1.8 liters) of soil is worth a sho of gold.'

It is said that Japan Conscription Insurance Company decided to destroy the building because it was a waste and bad economy to let a lot, which was large relative to the building, sit idle in the period, in which there is a dearth of buildings and a sho (a unit of volume that is equivalent to approximately 1.8 liters) of soil is worth a sho of gold.'

sen.j: 「取毀した敷地後にはバラツク仮建築を建築して商工省分室として貸室することに内定。」
sen.e: It decided informally to build a temporary shack in the site after the building is destroyed and rent it as a branch office of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry.'
It decided informally to build a temporary shack in the site after the building is destroyed and rent it as a branch office of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry.'
It decided informally to build a temporary shack in the site after the building is destroyed and rent it as a branch office of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry.'

sen.j: 「数日前から工事に着手した」。
sen.e: And it began the construction a few days ago.'
And it began the construction a few days ago.'
And it began the construction a few days ago.'

sen.j: その際に取外された階段と壁紙は、東京大学工学部建築学科に保存されている。
sen.e: The staircase and wallpaper removed at the time are preserved in the Department of Architecture of the School of Engineering of the University of Tokyo.
The staircase and wallpaper removed at the time are preserved in the Department of Architecture of the School of Engineering of the University of Tokyo.
The staircase and wallpaper removed at the time are preserved in the Department of Architecture of the School of Engineering of the University of Tokyo.

sen.j: また、その際に売却されたシャンデリアが江戸川区の灯明寺に残っている。
sen.e: The chandelier sold then is also kept in the Tomyo-ji Temple in Edogawa Ward.
The chandelier sold then is also kept in the Tomyo-ji Temple in Edogawa Ward.
The chandelier sold then is also kept in the Tomyo-ji Temple in Edogawa Ward.

sen.j: 建築家谷口吉郎は、鹿鳴館の滅失について、11月8日の東京日日新聞に「明治の哀惜」というタイトルで記事を寄せた。
sen.e: An architect, Yoshiro TANIGUCHI, wrote an article on the disappearance of the Rokumei-kan Pavilion with a title, 'Lamentation of Meiji,' for the Tokyo Nichi Nichi Shinbun.
An architect, Yoshiro TANIGUCHI, wrote an article on the disappearance of the Rokumei-kan Pavilion with a title, 'Lamentation of Meiji,' for the Tokyo Nichi Nichi Shinbun in November 8.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「11月8日の」を補足しました。
sen.e: An architect, Yoshiro TANIGUCHI, wrote an article on the disappearance of the Rokumei-kan Pavilion with a title, 'Lamentation of Meiji,' for the Tokyo Nichi Nichi Shinbun in November 8.

sen.j: 「明治に生れた人達が、自分の所持品を持ちよつて、それを小博物館にすることは出来なかつたらうか。」
sen.e: Could not people born in Meiji gather their belongings to create a small museum?'
Could not people born in Meiji period gather their belongings to create a small museum?'
Could not people born in Meiji period gather their belongings to create a small museum?'

sen.j: 「それこそいい明治の記念物となったらうに。」
sen.e: It would indeed have been a good memento of Meiji.'
It would indeed have been a good memento of Meiji.'
It would indeed have been a good memento of Meiji.'

sen.j: 「明治時代の人から、次の時代に贈るほんとにいい贈物になつたことと思ふ。」
sen.e: I believe it would have been a truly excellent gift for the future generations from the people of the Meiji Period.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: I believe it would have been a truly excellent gift for the future generations from the people of the Meiji period.'
I believe it would have been a truly excellent gift for the future generations from the people of the Meiji period.'

sen.j: 「新体制が活発な革新意識に燃えるものであるなら、それと反対に古い文化財に対しては極度に保守的であつて欲しいと思ふ。」
sen.e: If the new Establishment is fired with progressive consciousness, I wish it to be extremely conservative, on the contrary, with regard to the cultural assets.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: If the new establishment is fired with progressive consciousness, I wish it to be extremely conservative, on the contrary, with regard to the old cultural assets.'
If the new establishment is fired with progressive consciousness, I wish it to be extremely conservative, on the contrary, with regard to the old cultural assets.'

sen.j: 谷口は後に博物館明治村の開設に尽力した。
sen.e: He was later instrumental in establishing the Museum Meiji-mura Village.
Taniguchi was later instrumental in establishing the Museum Meiji-mura Village.
Taniguchi was later instrumental in establishing the Museum Meiji-mura Village.

sen.j: 初代館長となった。
sen.e: And he became the first director of the museum.
And he became the first director of the museum.
And he became the first director of the museum.

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）、鹿鳴館に外国人との融和交際の為に会員制の「東京倶楽部」が設けられた。
sen.e: In 1884, 'Tokyo Club' which was based on a membership system was created in the Rokumei-kan Pavilion to foster a harmonious association with foreigners.
In 1884, 'Tokyo Club' which was based on a membership system was created in the Rokumei-kan Pavilion to foster a harmonious association with foreigners.
In 1884, 'Tokyo Club' which was based on a membership system was created in the Rokumei-kan Pavilion to foster a harmonious association with foreigners.

sen.j: そこでは英語の使用に限られた。
sen.e: Only English was used there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Only English was used there.
Only English was used there.

sen.j: 日本語は勿論、他の外国語の使用は禁止された。
sen.e: And the use of any other languages including, of course, Japanese was prohibited.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And the use of any other languages including, of course, Japanese was prohibited.
And the use of any other languages including, of course, Japanese was prohibited.

sen.j: 鹿鳴館の廃止により（鹿鳴館と同じ）コンドル設計の建物が建てられた。
sen.e: Another building, which was also designed by Conder (like the Rokumei-kan Pavilion), was built after its abolition.
Another building, which was also designed by Conder (like the Rokumei-kan Pavilion), was built after its abolition.
Another building, which was also designed by Conder (like the Rokumei-kan Pavilion), was built after its abolition.

sen.j: そして移転した。
sen.e: And Tokyo Club was moved there.
And Tokyo Club was moved there.
And Tokyo Club was moved there.

sen.j: 現在は霞ヶ関ビル隣に東京倶楽部ビルがある。
sen.e: Today, the Tokyo Club Building sits next to the Kasumigaseki Building.
Today, the Tokyo Club Building sits next to the Kasumigaseki Building.
Today, the Tokyo Club Building sits next to the Kasumigaseki Building.
